text: Roger Rotherham was an English priest in the second half of the 15th century."Bibliotheca Topographica Britannica: Antiquities in Leicestershire, Volume 7" p487: London; J. Nicols; 1790 Rotherham was born in the West Riding of Yorkshire. He was Warden of King's Hall, Cambridge from 1473 to 1477;Alumni Cantabrigienses: A Biographical List of All Known Students, Graduates and Holders of Office at the University of Cambridge, from the Earliest Times to 1900, John Venn/John Archibald Venn Cambridge University Press > (10 volumes 1922 to 1953) Part II. 1752–1900 Vol. iii. Kaile – Ryves, (1924) p489 Archdeacon of Rochester from 1474 to 1475; and Archdeacon of Leicester from 1474 to 1478. == Notes == ==Also see== * Diocese of Lincoln * Diocese of Peterborough * Diocese of Leicester * Archdeacon of Leicester Category:People from the West Riding of Yorkshire (before 1974) Category:Archdeacons of Leicester Category:15th-century English people Category:Archdeacons of Rochester Category:Academics of the University of Cambridge
title: Roger Rotherham
